name: tforge.vim
description: This is the syntax file for Text::Forge templates. See http://text-forge.sf.net/ for more info on what Text::Forge is. This depends on a good html and perl syntax file, which comes with the default vim distribution.
install_details:
1) Move tforge.vim to your syntax directory (usually at $VIMRUNTIME/syntax/).

2) Add a few line to your filetype.vim script (usually at $VIMRUNTIME/filetype.vim):
\" Text::Forge
au BufNewFile,BufRead *.tf setf tforge

If you are editing a file that doesn&#039t have \".tf\" on the end, then you can just do this to get the highlighting:
:setf tforge
